identificationModule.briefTitle: Normobaric Hyperoxia Combined With Reperfusion for Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Safety and Efficacy of Normobaric Hyperoxia Combined With Reperfusion for Acute Ischemic Stroke：A Randomized, Controlled Pilot Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: NBO is a nonpharmacological measure of neuroprotection. The purpose of our study is to evaluate the safety and efficiency of NBO（Normobaric hyperoxia) in the acute ischemic stroke patients who received endovascular treatment. Looking for more clinical evidence for the ischemic stroke patients who will be treated with NBO in the future.

armGroups.label: NBO group
armGroups.description: Normobaric oxygen therapy is the delivery of high-flow oxygen (10L/min) via oxygen storage facemask. This therapy should start in the pre-hospital or emergency room as soon as possible (within 1 hours) after diagnosis of ischemic stroke and last for 4 hours. All participant will receive mechanical thrombectomy and a standard clinical therapy.

armGroups.label: Control group
armGroups.description: The participants receive mechanical thrombectomy therapy after diagnosed ischemic. All participants receive a standard clinical therapy.

interventions.name: Normobaric oxygen therapy
interventions.description: In this study, it is simple to administer via oxygen storage facemask at flow rates of 10 L/min for 4 hours. This therapy start should in Pre-hospital or emergency room as early as possible after diagnosed ischemic stroke and uninterrupted during other treatments including mechanical thrombolytic therapy and standard clinical treatment.

primaryOutcomes.description: Infarct volume is evaluated mainly through brain MRI(DWI)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Biomarkers for evaluation of BBB damage and brain injury:NSE、S100B、occludin、 claudin-5、MMP-9
secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the mRs is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0 = no symptoms to 5 = severe disability, and 6 = death)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The good prognosis at 90 days assessed by modified Rankin scale (mRS).
secondaryOutcomes.description: secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the mRs is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0 = no symptoms to 5 = severe disability, and 6 = death);The ratio of 0 to 2;

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Scores assessed by National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale(NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: secondary clinical efficacy endpoint; the NIHSS is a stroke severity score that is composed of 11 items; range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 2 hours ± 15 minutes, 24 ± 6 hours, 7 ± 2 days, 30 ± 5 days after randomization ]

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) score from baseline to 24 hours
secondaryOutcomes.description: secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the NIHSS is a stroke severity score composed of 11 items (range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits)

NIHSS score decreased by more than 4 points or NIHSS score was 0;secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the NIHSS is a stroke severity score composed of 11 items (range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits)
secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the BI is an ordinal disability score of 10 categories(range from 0 to 100, higher values indicate better prognosis);
NIHSS score increased by more than 4 points);the NIHSS is a stroke severity score composed of 11 items (range from 0 to 42, higher values indicate more severe deficits);clinical safety endpoint;

secondaryOutcomes.measure: any intracranial hemorrhage on 24-hour follow-up imaging
secondaryOutcomes.description: imaging safety endpoints;per ECASS III definition and per Heidelberg bleeding classification
imaging safety endpoints;Deterioration in NIHSS score of ≥4 points within 24 hours;per ECASS III definition and per Heidelberg bleeding classification

secondaryOutcomes.measure: TICI (Thrombolysis in Cerebral Infarction perfusion scale grade)
The infarct volume on 24-hour follow-up imaging
secondaryOutcomes.description: The infarct volume of cerebral infarct is evaluated by cranial CT;
secondary clinical efficacy endpoint;the mRs is an ordinal disability score of 7 categories (0 = no symptoms to 5 = severe disability, and 6 = death)

otherOutcomes.description: Stratify according to different risk factors：ASPECT; NIHSS; age;Ischemic penumbra volume; Site of occlusion; Time from stroke onset to randomization;Ischemic penumbra volume

references.citation: Li W, Qi Z, Ma Q, Ding J, Wu C, Song H, Yang Q, Duan J, Liu L, Kang H, Wu L, Ji K, Zhao W, Li C, Sun C, Li N, Fisher M, Ji X, Liu KJ. Normobaric Hyperoxia Combined With Endovascular Treatment for Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial. Neurology. 2022 Aug 23;99(8):e824-e834. doi: 10.1212/WNL.0000000000200775. Epub 2022 Jun 17. Erratum In: Neurology. 2023 Apr 25;100(17):844.
